messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:37): annevk, the problem with the black run at Tryvann is that it's a completely straight, fully groomed run. It's just fun because it's long and designed for high speed.
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (13:46): Did HTML ever allow the valign attribute to have "center" as value?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:53): 2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d: Off the top of my head, no
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (13:53): Guess they meant align then
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (13:54): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: *no* slope in Norway is designed for high speed if you have to carry a lift card
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (13:54): (in other word on open days)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:12): 2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d: I think there was some issue like you couldn't have the same keyword in two different enumerated attributes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:12): so it was align="center" and valign="middle"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:12): (due to weirdness of SGML DTDs)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:12): though I could be entirely making that up
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:13): i think that's accurate; sgml had a feature where you could omit the attribute name and just have the value
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:13): like <td center middle>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:13): Did that feature have to be explicitly enabled for each attribute in the DTD?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:13): no, it's enabled for all enumerated attributes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:15): (there's no concept of boolean attributes in sgml; they're just enumerated with one value)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): Hmm, indeed
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:15): I really wonder what the SGML people were smoking sometimes.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd"><title></title><table><tr><td center middle></table>
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): validator.w3.org says that's valid
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (14:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: They actually did mean align="center". Just replaced it with some CSS to text-align it.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:16): I like how <table valign=middle> causes the error message "Attribute "VALIGN" is not a valid attribute. Did you mean "valign"?"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:17): has someone reported a bug about that?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:18): Does anyone recall any improvements in IE8 that can be classified as "implementing HTML4 better"?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:18): I don't particular know of any lacks in their HTML4 implementation that they fixed in IE8.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:19): <abbr>? <object>?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:19): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-validator/2010Feb/0014.html mentions the bug
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:19): What was wrong with their <img alt>?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:20): they showed a tooltip
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:20): Well, I suppose they showed it in a tooltip.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:20): That one's not really implementing HTML4 better (closer to the spec), just changing a UI issue to better match expectations, right?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:20): they changed the parser for end tags
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:21): Ah, I really had no idea about that.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:21): at least </li>
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:22): which became incompatible with everyone else
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (14:23): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: you're implying the SGML people only smoked some times?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (14:24): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: Presumably they were sane when they were around their families.
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (14:24): you assume they had families?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:25): Helps them blend in to society, while they pursue their madcap markup schemes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:27): in the future people will imply we were smoking for making the platform overly insane for compat with a mere few billion documents
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:30): What do you mean "in the future" people ask that all the time in the present
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:30): And in the past it was the theory that gave us XHTML 2
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (14:30): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: just sent you the three questions to vote on
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:31): 040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721: thanks very much
040342c014ffc1c11592948bd92e3721 (14:32): gotta grab some sleep now - got an early meeting tomorrow
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (14:32): OK, nn
